questions.question_text: Ane e Bhagwān āpaṇne _____ besāḍe to hāthīe besīne rājī rahevu ane _____ besāḍe to gadheḍe besīne rājī rahevu.
questions.explanation: This is a direct quote from Vach.Ga.Pa.74 about accepting whatever Bhagwan gives us.

questions.question_text: “Jo mār mār karato koī āvato hoy to em samajavu je, ‘Mārā Swāmīnu ja karyu sarve thāy chhe, paṇ te vinā koīnu halāvyu pānaḍu paṇ halatu nathī.’”
questions.explanation: This quote emphasizes that everything happens according to Swami's will, even seemingly random events.

questions.question_text: Bhagwān to potānā bhaktanī _____ karavāmā ja beṭhā chhe. Kenī peṭhe? To jem pāpaṇ ānkhanī _____ kare chhe ne hāth kanṭhanī rakṣhā kare chhe ne māvatar chhokarānī rakṣhā kare chhe ne rājā prajānī rakṣhāmā chhe, tem ja Bhagwān āpaṇī rakṣhāmā chhe.
questions.explanation: This quote from Swamini Vato uses analogies to illustrate how Bhagwan protects his devotees.

questions.question_text: “āpaṇe jyāre tan-man-dhan Bhagwānne arpaṇ karyu tyāre have Bhagwānnī ichchhā te ja āpaṇu prārabdha chhe, te vinā bīju koī prārabdha nathī. Māṭe Bhagwānnī ichchhāe karīne game tevu sukh-dukh āve, temā koī rīte akaḷāī javu nahī”
questions.explanation: This Vachanamrut emphasizes accepting whatever happens as Bhagwan's will after surrendering everything to him.

questions.question_text: Antarmā ṭāḍhu rahyā kare ne dhagī na jāy tenā be upāy chhe: ek to Bhagwānnu _____ karavu ne bīju Bhagwānne sarva-kartā samajavā ne temā sukh āve to sukh bhogavī levu ne dukh āve to dukh bhogavī levu.
questions.explanation: This Swamini Vato explains two ways to remain calm: bhajan and understanding Bhagwan as the doer.

questions.question_text: “Ane e Bhagwān āpaṇne hāthīe besāḍe to hāthīe besīne rājī rahevu ane gadheḍe besāḍe to gadheḍe besīne rājī rahevu. Ane e Bhagwānnā charaṇārvind vinā bīje kyāy prīti rākhavī nahī...e Bhagwānnu karyu sarve thāy chhe. Māṭe sūku pānaḍu jem vāyune ādhāre fare tem e Bhagwānne ādhīn rahīne ānandmā e Parameshvarnu bhajan karavu ane koī jātno manmā udveg āvavā devo nahī.”
questions.explanation: This quotation is from Vachanamrut Gadhada I-74.

questions.question_text: Te kahyu chhe je, _____ dushman Hari ke’dī hoy nahi, jem karashe tem sukh ja thāshe.
questions.explanation: This is part of a quote emphasizing that whatever Hari does is ultimately beneficial for his devotees.

questions.question_text: Je dukhe thāy sukh janne, te de chhe dukh dayā kari | jeha sukhe dukh upaje, te āpe nahi kedi hari ||
questions.explanation: This is a quote from the Dhiraj Akhyan kirtan.

questions.question_text: Māṭe sūku _____ jem vāyune ādhāre fare tem e Bhagwānne ādhīn rahīne ānandmā e Parameshvarnu bhajan karavu ane koī jātno manmā udveg āvavā devo nahī.
questions.explanation: This quote emphasizes surrendering to Bhagwan like a dry leaf to the wind, from Vachanamrut Gadhada I-74.

questions.question_text: āpaṇe jyāre _____-man-dhan Bhagwānne arpaṇ karyu tyāre have Bhagwānnī ichchhā te ja āpaṇu prārabdha chhe, te vinā bīju koī prārabdha nathī.
questions.explanation: This Vachanamrut explains that after surrendering 'tan-man-dhan' (body, mind, wealth), only Bhagwan's will matters.
